mcmcr 0.5.0.9001

Zero MCMC sample values

Source: R/zero.R
zero.Rd

Zeros an MCMC object's sample values.

zero(x, ...)

# S3 method for mcarray
zero(x, ...)

# S3 method for mcmcarray
zero(x, ...)

# S3 method for mcmcr
zero(x, pars = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

The MCMC object.
...

Unused.
pars

A character vector (or NULL) of the pars to zero.

Value

The MCMC

Details

It is used for removing the effect of a random effect where the expected value is 0.

Methods (by class)

  • mcarray: Zero an mcarray object

  • mcmcarray: Zero an mcmcarray object

  • mcmcr: Zero an mcmcr object

Examples

zero(mcmcr_example, pars = "beta")
#> Warning: `zero()` was deprecated in mcmcr v0.2.1.
#> Please use `fill_all()` instead.
#> $alpha
#> [1] 3.718025 4.718025
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#> 
#> $beta
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    0    0
#> [2,]    0    0
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#> 
#> $sigma
#> [1] 0.7911975
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#>
